edu.stanford.nlp.ie.machinereading

Class BasicEntityExtractor

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.stanford.nlp.ie.machinereading.BasicEntityExtractor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Extractor, Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    RothEntityExtractor

    public class BasicEntityExtractor
extends Object
implements Extractor
    Uses parsed files to train classifier and test on data set.
    Author:
    Andrey Gusev, Mason Smith, David McClosky (mcclosky@stanford.edu)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • makeAnnotationFromGivenNERTag

        public void makeAnnotationFromGivenNERTag(CoreMap sentence,
                                 String nerTag,
                                 String entityType)
        Converts NamedEntityTagAnnotation tags into EntityMentions. This finds the longest sequence of NamedEntityTagAnnotation tags of the matching type.
        Parameters:
        sentence - A sentence, ideally annotated with NamedEntityTagAnnotation
        nerTag - The name of the NER tag to copy, e.g. "DATE".
        entityType - The type of the EntityMention objects created

      • makeAnnotationFromAllNERTags

        public void makeAnnotationFromAllNERTags(CoreMap sentence)
        Converts NamedEntityTagAnnotation tags into EntityMentions. This finds the longest sequence of NamedEntityTagAnnotation tags of the matching type.
        Parameters:
        sentence - A sentence annotated with NamedEntityTagAnnotation

      • runTestSet

        public void runTestSet(List<List<CoreLabel>> testSet)
        This should be called after the classifier has been trained and parseAndTrain has been called to accumulate test set This will return precision,recall and F1 measure

      • load

        public static BasicEntityExtractor load(String path,
                        Class<? extends BasicEntityExtractor> entityClassifier,
                        boolean preferDefaultGazetteer)
                                 throws ClassCastException,
                                        IOException,
                                        ClassNotFoundException
        Loads the model from disk.
        Parameters:
        path - The location of model that was saved to disk
        Throws:
        ClassCastException - if model is the wrong format
        IOException - if the model file doesn't exist or is otherwise unavailable/incomplete
        ClassNotFoundException - this would probably indicate a serious classpath problem
